newsitem.title: INDONESIA: Indonesian rupiah up on exchange rate reports.
newsitem.headline: Indonesian rupiah up on exchange rate reports.

text.p: Indonesia's rupiah strengthened against the dollar in hectic late trading on Friday following a statement by the central bank governor that he did not believe in using exchange rates to boost exports, dealers said.
Sudradjad Djiwandono told an economic conference on Friday he was not a true believer in using the exchange rate as a tool to boost export competitiveness.
One U.S. bank dealer said the statement triggered offshore dollar unloading and sent spot rupiah up to a high of 2,332.50 before it fell again on central bank fixing.
Dealers said a surprise move by the central bank to raise its fixing by another point sparked off dollar buying but it failed to maintain the gain it made due to foreign pressure.
The central bank raised its intervention band to 2,333/2525 and the conversion rate to 2333/2381.
Spot rupiah was last at 2,333.50/34.00 at 0900 GMT against an opening of 2332.50/33.50. Today closed at 2,333.00/33.50. Overnight swap was at 0.9 points.
Spot/next was at 0.4/0.5 points. Overnight money was last quoted at 8.25 percent on the back of ample liquidity.
Dealers said it was stable at that level because of a central bank offer of overnight papers (SBIs) at eight percent.
The market has experienced a rare four-point depreciation of the rupiah by the central bank this week after a weekly three-point hike in the past three weeks.
The U.S. bank dealer said operators were a bit surprised by the governor's statement and the depreciation policy.
"But it seems that people are putting more weight on the exchange rate statement as reflected by the renewed dollar selling after a brief uptrend," the dealer said.
"It's been a volatile day. Sentiment now seems to favour the rupiah despite flush supply," he said.
Dealers said the money market was surprisingly ample one day after the end of Bank Negara Indonesia's share offering.
But they said early central bank injection of more than one trillion rupiah seemed to aid the condition.
Dealers said swap rates fluctuated following the governor's statement, but they remained on a softer tone.
One-month swap was at 15.50/16.50, two at 32.0/33.0, three at 48.0/50.0 and six at 94.50/96.0 points.
